page.title: 03Farming in the Dale area
page.content: There are 4 large(200 acres +) and 4 smaller farms in the area.All the large farms are engaged in mixed agriculture. About half their land is under crops,chiefly early potatoes and barley.Early potatoes are planted by machine in Feb./March.They are irrigated if necessary and are ready for picking(by hand,owing to the sloping ground)in June.Grass is then sown.Barley is usually sown in Spring and harvested by combine in August.The rest of the land is under grass;used for hay,silage,grazing for beef cattle and wintering sheep.Ploughing is usually done with a 5-blade plough. Grass is cut and harvested by machine and other cultivating operations are done by up-to-date machinery.The smaller farms use their land in a specialised way,usually calf-rearing. One farm is a dairy farm with 120 cows
